By CHB on Monday, March 29, 2004 - 05:37 pm:

"Hey, Infernos & Eric, guess what? Not everyone has played MR2, and not everyone owns a Game Boy Advice! So maybe you can keep the sarcasm to yourselves..."

Also to include:

"however, it is pointless to remind me, because i am only posting monsters of which i would like to see in monster rancher 5 therefore, STOP FRIGGIN REMINDING ME THAT THEY'RE ALREADY THERE!"


Maybe you should start a 'renaming' thread for tecmo instead of a 'wishlist' in which you simply change their names.

If you want monsters to make a return, ask for THOSE monsters, don't make up new ones.

I don't own a GBA, and never played the MRA games. I own MR3, but quit after my third monster. I never played MR1 or Hop-About, either.

How about that? I've successfully played the following MR titles.

MR2
MR3 (if it even counts)
MR4

And I still don't come up with stupid stuff like just renaming monsters. Just because people would like to see actual NEW monsters on a wish list, or a NEW combination of a prime breed and a sub, doesn't earn a reply telling them to basically shut up. Not playing the games doesn't mean you can't browse here. Its an archive.

I see no 'sarcasm' in Eric's or Infernus's quotes. They said flat, "Stop naming monsters that exist."

And why? THAT'S POINTLESS. We currently have a monster list.

Off that...

I want to see a Kato/Henger. Claws could be plasma blades, three on each hand. WEEEE! *shudders*

One of the monsters I always wanted to see was a Hydra type, but I was making that suggestion back for MR3. Like a Dragon, with three heads and two tails, then subtract the wings and arms. Change the scales to something more like a snake, add some attacks, and you got yourself a Hydra.

Someone wanted something like a Werelion once, named the breed Leo, and it sounded pretty sweet. Like a monk with a sword, mixed with a paladin and the king of the cats.

Someone else wanted, and I quote, "A Killer Chicken". I regretfully informed him that Duckons existed. They said they wanted a Rambo bird, to include some form of semi-automatic weapon.

Either way, I'm not trying to be rude, but I have to back who I believe is right. Everyone already knows that if MR5 comes out, most people want all the monsters from all the games, for shear playability reasons.

So stop naming them.
